text:
Arcadia is a city in Crawford County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 310 people lived there.
History.
Arcadia was founded in 1862. It was named for the ancient region of Arcadia, in Greece.
The first post office in Arcadia was founded in June 1867.
Arcadia was a station on the St. Louis–San Francisco Railway.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 310 people, 136 households, and 79 families living in the city.
